Data.Title: May
Data.Description: May is often used to express likelihood or probability
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>May Structure: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Suj + May (or may not) + verb.</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:Pigs may flight
R01:He may come later
R01:I may go to the party later
R01:They may raise my salary
R02:I may get my salary raise
R02:I may not get any holidays until 20 - 25.
R02:That may be a good idea.
R02:I may not have time to do it today.
SpanishExamples: Puede que los cerdos vuelen.
El podría venir luego.
Quizá vaya a la fiesta luego.
Quizá me suban el salario.
Puede que mi salario sea subido.
Puede que no tenga vacaciones hasta el  20 - 25
Puede que eso sea una buena idea
Puede que no tenga tiempo para hacerlo hoy.

Data.Title: Must & Have to
Rules: R02:<color=#5bd3de>Have to: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Obligations, and something you have to do, an exteral rule.</color>
R04:<color=#5bd3de>Don't have to: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Don't necessary to do something.</color>
R05:<color=#5bd3de>Must II: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Uses for logic conclusions. (Use in positive and negative)</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:I must go to work
R01:I must study English.
R01:You must go for a walk with the dog at least once a day.
R01:I must finish this report.
R02:I have to pay the taxes.
R02:I'll have to move house next year.
R02:I have to tell you something. (There isn't another option)
R02:I have to invite my boss.(It's an obligation)
R03:You mustn't call me
R03:They mustn't drive tonight
R03:We mustn't talk to anyone.
R03:In future you mustn't call me at work.
R04:She doesn't have to visit her mother.
R04:In a smoking area you don’t have to smoke bur you can do it if you want.
R04:You don't have to wear a tie for school.
R05:You're not wearing a coat. You must be cold
R05:He always looks tired, he must work very hard.
R05:I called her twice but she didn't answer. She must be busy.
R05:I haven't seen John for months. He musn't work here anymore.

Debo estudiar iIglés.

En un area para fumar no tienes porqué fumar pero puedes  hacederlo si quieres.

Data.Title: Be able to
Data.Description: Be able to means: Ser capa de
Rules: R01:<color=#5bd3de>The meaning is similar to can/could: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Be able to can be use in any tense: To be able to + infinitive </color>
R02:<color=#5bd3de>Negative sentences: </color><color=#c9e8ff>Could and was/were able to have the same meaning.</color>
EnglishExamples: R01:You will be able to get tickets to the concert if you arrive at the box office early.
R01:The kids have not been able to study much today.
R01:After I had been able to open the box, I discovered that it was empty.
R01:If Betsy danced every day, she would be able to become a professional dancer.
R02:The climbers couldn’t /weren’t able to reach the summit yesterday.
R02:Tom couldn’t/wasn’t able to win the contest last year.
R02:Jim was not able to meet Richard yesterday.
SpanishExamples: Serás capaz de conseguir tickets para el concierto si llegas pronto al estanco.
Los niños no han sido capaces de estudiar mucho hoy.
Después de que había podido abrir la caja, descubrí que estaba vacía.
Si Betsy bailara todos los días, podría haber sido una bailarina profesional.
Los escaladores no pudieron llegar a la cima ayer.
Tom no pudo ganar el concurso el año pasado.
Jim no pudo encontrarse con Richard ayer.
